page.title: 01Gazeteer of the Area
page.content:
The area is predominantly chalk downland but includes the valley of the River Cuckmere. The villages of Alfriston and Wilmington are in the area along with churches at Wilmington ,Alfriston,Lullington and Folkington.
Most of the area is farmland,mainly arable with sheep and cattle grazing on the hills. There are many paths over the downs including the South Downs Way.
Dominating the area is the Long Man of Wilmington which overlooks beautiful village of Wilmington.
There are many timber framed buildings in both Alfriston and Wilmington including the Old Clergy House,Alfriston,the first building owned by the National Trust.
